The claim was made by AOL co: founder Steve Case during a discussion on CNN's State of the Union on July 3, 2011.
The claim was based on a statistic from: a bipartisan group of mayors and business leaders.
The report: titled "The 'New American' Fortune 500," analyzed the origin of the founders of the top 500 revenue-producing companies published by Fortune Magazine.
According to the report: more than 40 percent of the 2010 Fortune 500 companies were founded by immigrants or their children.
